author: Special Correspondent
text:
Miscreants broke into a house belonging to a doctor and professor couple in Brindavanam on Thursday.

According to police, the head of the family, Aravindan is working as a professor in Annamalai University, Chidambaram and his wife Umamaheshwari is working as a doctor at Government Hospital in Gorimedu.

Last night when they were sleeping inside the air-conditioned room, the miscreants entered the house by breaking open the back door and decamped with jewellery kept in the chest of bureau and silver articles.

When they woke up in the morning, Dr. Umamaheshwari was shocked to find that the door was broken and jewellery, silver articles were looted. She immediately alerted her husband who lodged a complaint with D’ Nagar police.

Mr. Aravindan, the owner of the house, stated in his complaint that the miscreants took away gold and silver ornaments worth Rs. 8 lakh. D’Nagar police registered the complaint and investigated the case.

Finger prints were collected from the scene of occurrence besides sniffer dog was deployed into service.
title: Burglars break into a house at Brindavanam
